At the part where they are talking about how they are offering a "weapon"... through the framework of softwar, Bitcoin is a non-lethal weapons technology. A non-lethal physical power competition.

Also when they say China and Russia have gone dark and shows the monitor with the countries, it says Siberia, not Russia. Siberia is where Russia mines a lot of its Bitcoin because of the abundant energy and ambiently cool temperatures.

Lowery describes how although Bitcoin is a physical power competition, humanity also is simultaneously cooperating to mutually benefit all members of the network by increasing security and freedom of information flow across cyberspace. Enemies become frenemies, adversarial nations become de facto collaborators. 

A non-zero sum game where the entire organization becomes more prosperous.
"Weapon opens time" is a refferance to how Bitcoin can lower our entire species time preference.

So although Bitcoin doesn't alter our perception of time like the heptapods language does to Louise, the cultural adoption of Bitcoin will cause a cognitive change in the way our species perceives time at a neural architectural level.

Similar to how mastering fire caused cognitive change in earlier homo genus ancestors.
